0.user_question: Solo has to read 4 pages from his Science textbook, 405027 pages from his Social Studies textbook, 7 pages from his History textbook and 8 pages from his Geography textbook. Solo read 15 pages on Monday. If he has 4  more days to complete all his reading, how many pages does he need to read, on average, in one day?

ost_step.1: Solo has to read a total of 4+4050+7+8=49 pages.
ost_step.2: He already read 15 pages on Monday.
ost_step.3: So he has (49-15) = 34 pages remaining to read over the next 4 days.

direct_answer.text: Let's think step by step. Solo has to read a total of 49 pages. He already read 15 pages on Monday. That leaves 49 - 15 = 34 pages remaining to read over the next 4 days. Each day, he needs to read (34 / 4) = approximately 8.5 pages, rounded up to 9 pages. The answer is: 9.
